Cartridge Assembly Technician – Chalgrove, Oxfordshire

Hours:
Monday–Thursday, 8:00am–4:45pm, Friday 8:00am–12:00pm
(Transitioning to a 4-on, 4-off shift pattern from March/April 07:00am to 4.30pm (177 shifts per year. Shift allowance applies from after the transition.)
Join the team that saves lives in the skies.
At
Martin-Baker
, we’ve been protecting aircrew for over 80 years as the world leader in ejection and crashworthy seat technology. Every component you help create contributes to a system that has saved over 7,700 lives worldwide.
We’re now looking for a
Cartridge Assembly Technician
to join our Cartridge and Rocket team at Chalgrove. This hands-on role involves precision assembly, packing and inspection of cartridges for pyrotechnic components that form a vital part of our life-saving systems.
What You’ll Be Doing
You’ll play a key part in the manufacturing of cartridges ensuring everything meets our strict safety and quality standards. Typical responsibilities include:
Assembly of category 1 (low complexity) cartridges following company build plans, process work instructions and engineering drawings.
Kitting components for assembly and preparation of hardware for use in assembly.
Packing cartridges and rocket motors into a specified licensed packaging in accordance with drawing and customer requirements. Includes labelling and palletising for shipment to customers.
Visual inspection of cartridges and rocket motors ensuring conformance to engineering drawings, company requirements and specifications
Transporting and organising components, tooling, and assemblies across departments.
Contributing to risk assessments, audits, and maintaining a culture of explosive safety.
About You
We’re looking for a hands-on, safety-conscious individual with a strong mechanical mindset and a passion for precision.
Requirements:
Experience in manufacturing/component assembly
Basic experience of reading and interpreting engineering drawings
Be a Team player with the ability to work independently
Can work under pressure to balance priorities to agreed deadlines
PC skills
Solid data analysis skills
Solid verbal communication skills
What’s In It For You
At Martin-Baker, we take care of our people. Our benefits include:
9% non-contributory pension (18+)
4x salary Life Assurance (18+)
Personalised training & development plan
Healthcare Cash Plan
Cycle to Work & nursery benefits
Discounts via the Martin-Baker+ platform
Your Interview Journey
You’ll start with a detailed screening call with your Recruitment Business Partner, followed by a structured interview with the hiring manager and a short trade test to demonstrate your practical skills and engineering knowledge.

Martin-Baker is a proudly British engineering company and the world’s leading manufacturer of ejection seats. Our mission is simple
to save aircrew lives
.
We are committed to
inclusion, equal opportunity
, and proud to support the
Armed Forces Covenant
.

.

title: CNC Programmer/Setter
description_text:
< Back to job list
CNC Programmer/Setter
3T Additive Manufacturing
Thatcham, Berkshire, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
Advertised Salary:
Competitive
Ref#:
147063
We’re looking for an experienced CNC Programmer/Setter/Operator to join our precision engineering team in Thatcham, RG19 6HN. In this role, you’ll be responsible for programming, setting and operating multi-axis CNC machines to deliver complex, high-end components with exceptional accuracy for the Aerospace, Defence and Automotive industries using advanced 4 & 5-axis CNC milling machines and CNC Turning Centres.
39.5 hours per week, Mon to Thur 08.30 – 16.30 & Fri 08.30 – 16.00
You will receive
:
A competitive salary
25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays)
Private Healthcare
In-service Life Assurance benefit of x 4 salary
Career development
Key Responsibilities
The work is varied, combining one-off development parts with small to medium batch runs, all requiring a keen eye for detail and pride in workmanship.  Taking ownership of the full process, from tool selection and setup through to inspection, activity will include:
Programming, setting and operating 3, 4 & 5 axis CNC milling machines and CNC Turning Centres
Producing precision components to tight tolerances and high-quality standards
Managing tool life, setting datums, and running probing programmes
Supporting new product introductions and continuous improvement activities
Working independently and as part of a skilled machining team
Skills & Experience
Experience in CNC (multi-axis) programming, setting and operating is essential
Manufacturing knowledge of Hard Metal finishing/machining
Experience in machining for Aerospace, Automotive or Defence preferred
Knowledge of Heidenhain/Fanuc/Edgecam/Vericut is beneficial
Ability to read engineering drawings and interpret complex tolerances
Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality workmanship
Time-served apprentice or equivalent practical experience
Right to work in the UK: Visa sponsorship is not available, now or in the future, for this position
Why join us?
3T AM is a market leader in Advanced Manufacturing, utilising additive manufacturing to produce high-performance metallic components for household-name companies across Aerospace, Defence, Space, Energy, and Industrial sectors.
You’ll be part of a forward-thinking engineering team producing some of the most technically challenging and high-precision components in the industry. We offer a supportive environment, opportunities to develop your technical skills, and the chance to work with cutting-edge CNC technology.

description_text:
< Back to job list
Head of HR
ResourceBank
London, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
Advertised Salary:
Competitive
Ref#:
147389
Head of Human Resources - Senior Leadership Team | C-Suite Interface
We are supporting our client in appointing a Head of Human Resources to a critical senior leadership role. Reporting directly to the Managing Director, this position has end-to-end accountability for the people strategy across the business, and with close collaboration across European stakeholders.
This is a high-impact role suited to a seasoned HR leader who can balance strategic influence with operational depth, and who has experience navigating post-merger integration, organisational change, and HR transformation
Role Scope & Impact
Responsible for shaping and delivering a people strategy that supports business performance, growth, and cultural alignment, the Head of HR will balance strategic leadership with operational excellence, ensuring people initiatives are commercially focused, legally compliant, and aligned to the long-term business strategy. Key accountabilities include:
Acting as a trusted advisor to the Managing Director and Senior Leadership Team on all people, culture, and organisational matters
Leading post-merger HR integration activity, ensuring delivery against agreed milestones
Driving a high-performance culture through leadership capability, engagement, and robust performance management
Full ownership of Employee Relations, reward, compensation & benefits, workforce planning, and governance
Oversight of talent strategy including attraction, employer branding, onboarding, succession, and retention
Leading major HR transformation programmes, including shared services design, HR systems and platform upgrades, Centres of Excellence, and Learning & Development infrastructure
Ensuring strong compliance, audit readiness, and high-quality people data to inform board and executive decision-making
Provide strategic leadership to the General Affairs team, guiding the Head of HSQE and Facilities to maintain best practice standards and ensure alignment with all relevant legislation and processes.
Candidate profile
Experienced HR and General Affairs leader with the credibility and gravitas to operate at executive level, and influence decision-making. You will bring:
CIPD/equivalent qualified – ideally Level 7
Minimum 3 years’ experience at Head of HR or Senior HR Business Partner level within a complex organisation
Technical expertise across ER, recruitment, reward, performance management, talent and knowledge of UK employment law
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to align people strategy to business outcomes
Track record of leading organisational change and post-merger integration
A people-centred leadership style combined with resilience, pragmatism, and emotional intelligence
The opportunity
This role offers genuine executive influence, visibility at board level, and the opportunity to shape culture and capability. It will appeal to HR leaders seeking a role with scale, complexity, and the mandate to make a meaningful, long-term impact.

As a world leader in logistics and a top employer globally, DHL Global Forwarding is committed to excellence, compliance, and continuous improvement. We are looking for a dynamic

About the Role
This is a key leadership role, where you will be responsible for managing a complex 24/7 air freight operation spanning 150,000 sq ft. You will oversee the day-to-day operations, ensure security and compliance standards are maintained, and lead a diverse, unionised team (110 FTE) to success.

25 days holiday plus bank holidays

Charity and volunteering support through the DHL Foundation
Access to DHL Advantages, including discounts on high-street stores, restaurants, and gyms
Key Responsibilities:
Operational Leadership
Lead a 24/7 air freight operation at one of the largest facilities near Heathrow, ensuring the effective handling of complex and diverse cargo.
Implement and track performance metrics to drive continuous operational improvements.
Oversee the review and optimisation of shift patterns, ensuring the effective allocation of resources across the team.
Team Management
Manage a team of five direct reports, including four duty managers on rotating shifts.
Focus on coaching and developing your team, ensuring they have the tools, training, and support to excel.
Build and nurture a strong culture of growth and performance, helping staff advance their careers within the company.
Aviation Compliance & Security
Ensure full compliance with aviation security protocols and Dangerous Goods by Air (DG) regulations.
Drive safety and security measures to mitigate risks and ensure a safe working environment for all staff.
Financial & Facilities Management
Oversee P&L management and ensure cost control across the operation while maintaining high standards of service.
Manage procurement and facilities maintenance to ensure the smooth running of the warehouse.

Proven experience in managing complex warehouse and air freight operations, ideally in a 24/7 environment.
Strong leadership skills and experience in managing a unionised workforce.
Ability to build performance metrics, optimise shift patterns, and implement process improvements.
In-depth knowledge of aviation security, Dangerous Goods by Air (DG), ADR and GDP/MHRA compliance.
Strong background in financial and facilities management.
